content:
• Wednesday, January 17, 2018
  • AES

    AES pops as ValueAct takes stake, pledges clean energy push

    • AES Corp. (NYSE:AES) +4.6% after-hours following news that ValueAct Capital Management has taken an active stake in the power generator.
    • AES says ValueAct founder Jeffrey Ubben will join its board to help push for cleaner energy resources and will work with the company on its plan to sell coal assets, reduce debt and develop more solar power and battery storage.
    • As of November, ~37% of AES’s power production still came from coal, and the company has set a goal of reducing the figure to 33% by the end of 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM | 9 Comments
  • ARWR

    Bloomberg: Arrowhead offering at $40M, up to 12.6% discount

    • Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARWR) is off 10% after hours on word that its equity offering will come at $5.00-$5.25/share, an 8.2%-12.6% discount vs. today's close of $5.72.
    • Shares are quoted at $5.15 after hours at the moment.
    • The offering will come in at $40M, Bloomberg reports. Shares will come via Jefferies, Barclays, and Cantor Fitzgerald.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM | 10 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers (1/17/2018)

    • Top gainers: ESIO +22.9%. PTC +7.1%. AES +4.7%. SQM +3.3%. TSM +2.9%.
    • Top losers: ARWR -9.8%. PRTK -8.4%. PLXS -6.8%. SLM -4.3%. IIPR -4.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • ESIO

    ESI reports strong preliminary Q3 results; shares +22% AH

    • Electro Scientific Industries (NASDAQ:ESIO) now expects Q3 revenue in the range of $106M - $111M vs. a consensus of $85M.
    • The company now expects adj. EPS above the guided range provided on Nov. 1 vs. a consensus of $0.55.
    • The company also expects to report Q3 bookings of ~$134M (+204% Y/Y).
    • CEO Michael Burger: “Given the strong third quarter demand, our currently elevated backlog position and our visibility into the current buy cycle, we now expect fourth quarter 2018 and first quarter 2019 revenues to approximate the same level as the third quarter.”
    • The company anticipates reporting its Q3 results on Jan. 31.
    • Shares +22% AH
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • AAPL

    Bloomberg: Apple employees will get $2,500 bonus

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) will issue employee bonuses of $2,500 worth of restricted stock units, according to Bloomberg sources. The bonuses come as the company plans to repatriate most of its overseas cash.  
    • Employees below the senior-level director position will be eligible. Apple has over 120K employees including its retail store workers.
    • Apple closed today up 1.7%. 
    • Previously: Apple plans to add $350B to US economy, $38B in repatriated tax payments (Jan. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 121 Comments
  • PLXS

    Plexus -6.8% after Q1 misses, mixed guidance

    • Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS) shares are down 6.8% aftermarket following Q1 results that missed EPS and revenue estimates. Mixed Q2 guidance has revenue from $670M to $710M (consensus: $693.60M) and EPS from $0.68 to $0.78 (consensus: $0.82).
    • Sector performance: Healthcare/Life Sciences, $237M (+12% Y/Y); Industrial/Commercial, $207M (+0.5%); Communications, $133M (+1.5%); Aerospace/Defense, $100M (+15%). 
    • Financials: ROIC, 16.2%; FCF, $52.4M; cash and equivalents, $506.7M. 
    • Press release       
    • Previously: Plexus misses by $0.05, misses on revenue (Jan. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa -5% as Q4 earnings come up short

    • Alcoa (AA +1.3%) -4.9% after-hours as Q4 earnings and revenues, which rose 25% from the year-ago quarter to $3.17B, miss Wall Street expectations.
    • AA reports Q4 EBITDA of $775M, up 38% Q/Q, on higher alumina pricing, but company guidance was for greater than $800M; for FY 2018, the company projects EBITDA at $2.6B-$2.8B.
    • For 2018, AA projects balanced global bauxite and alumina markets and a global aluminum deficit of 300K-700K metric tons, and sees 2018 global aluminum demand growth of 4.25%-5.25%, following the company's final 2017 global demand growth rate of 5.25%.
    • AA also announces changes to its U.S. and Canada defined benefit pension plans which it expects to both reduce its net pension and other post-employment benefits liability by $35M and record ~$20M in non-cash non-operating income in Q1 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 6 Comments
  • PTC

    PTC +5.7% after Q1 beats, in-line guidance

    • PTC (NASDAQ:PTC) shares are up 5.7% aftermarket following Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. In-line Q2 guidance has revenue from $300M to $305M (consensus: $302.53M) and EPS from $0.28 to $0.32 (consensus: $0.32).
    • In-line FY18 guidance has revenue from $1.235B to $1.25B (consensus: $1.23B) with EPS from $1.29 to $1.39 (consensus: $1.36).
    • Key metrics: Software revenue, $265M (+10% Y/Y); license and subscription bookings, $104M; subscription mix, 67%; total deferred revenue (billed and unbilled), $1.17B (+42%); subscription Annualized Recurring Revenue, $402M (+84%). 
    • More financials: Non-GAAP operating expenses, $183M (+$13M Y/Y); operating margin, 17% (+2 percentage points); operating cash flow, $25M; FCF, $19M; cash and equivalents, $342M; total debt, $743M. 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: PTC beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Jan. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • PRTK

    Paratek Pharma readies $50M stock offering; shares off 10% after hours

    • Paratek Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PRTK) initiates a $50M public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 10% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 28 Comments
  • FOLD

    Amicus launches Galafold in Spain; shares up 5% after hours

    • Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) commences the commercial launch of Galafold (migalastat) for the treatment of Fabry disease in Spain.
    • CEO John Crowley says, "The commercial launch of Galafold in Spain adds to the tremendous momentum in expanding our launch throughout the EU, where we have now secured reimbursement in all five countries that have the largest Fabry populations within the EU. We believe that our pricing and reimbursement success throughout the EU, in addition to our global progress in securing additional approvals and completing new regulatory submissions, are a testament to the significant value of migalastat as the first oral precision medicine for people living with Fabry disease who have an amenable mutation.”
    • Shares are up 5% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • OPGN

    OpGen reverse splits shares 1:25; shares down 9% after hours

    • Aimed at regaining Nasday's listing requirement of a minimum $1 bid price, OpGen (NASDAQ:OPGN) executes a 1:25 reverse split of its common shares effective today. Post-split trading commences tomorrow.
    • Shares are down 9% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Kinder Morgan (NYSE:KMI): Q4 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $3.63B (+7.1% Y/Y) beats by $130M.
    • Shares +1.4%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 52 Comments
  • ARWR

    Arrowhead readies equity offering; shares down 7% after hours

    • Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARWR) is down 7% after hours in response to its announced stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 7 Comments
  • DSX

    J.P. Morgan downgrades Diana Shipping, Navios Maritime Partners

    • Diana Shipping (DSX -5.7%) and Navios Maritime Partners (NMM -2.6%) are lower after J.P. Morgan downgrades shares of both dry bulk carriers to Neutral from Overweight ahead of a cycle peak the firm expects later this year or in early 2019.
    • The firm says DSX's low risk profile limits upside potential vs. more spot-oriented companies, and it is concerned about the company's economic exposure to container shipping through its loans to Diana Containerships (DCIX +3%).
    • JPM says its NMM downgrade is based primarily on valuation, as the company enjoys positives such as low leverage, relatively higher charter coverage, low cost basis and diversification into the containership sector through long-term charters.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 28 Comments
  • YY

    Nomura boosts YY ADRs to Buy; shares at session high

    • ADRs in YY have moved up to a session high, up 3.4%, after an upgrade to Buy from Neutral at Nomura.
    • The firm has raised its price target to $161 from $80, implying 18.7% upside from the current price.
    • The ADRs have doubled over the past six months and risen 214% over the past 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 10 Comments
  • GOOG

    Google Clips passes FCC, release coming soon?

    • Google’s (GOOG, GOOGL) Clips camera received FCC certification this week and could release soon, according to Variety.
    • Google announced the $249 camera at the October launch event. The always-on camera uses AI to automatically shoot short videos and still pictures of moments the user would find interesting. 
    • The FCC filing lists the model number “G015A,” which has popped up on promo images of the device. 
    • GoPro (NASDAQ:GPRO) shares dropped 0.6% on the news even though Clips isn’t an action camera.       
    • Previously: Google Pixel 2 launch event: Live updates (Oct. 4, 2017)
    • Previously: GoPro shares down after Google launch event (Oct. 4, 2017)
    • Previously: GoPro up after JPMorgan dismisses Clips concerns (Oct. 6, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 13 Comments
  • BA

    Dow rides Boeing's dizzying rise to 300-pont gain

    • The Dow surges more than 300 points toward its best single session rise in about seven weeks, boosted by another big gain in Boeing (BA +3.6%), which has contributed about a third of the Dow’s rise from its first close above 25,000 on Jan. 4, by far the most points of any index constituent.
    • Boeing also continues to climb faster than any other stock in the index, up another 17% YTD after rising 89% last year.
    • Analysts are jumping on the bandwagon, with B. Riley raising its BA stock price target to $433 from $380 as it expects a solid Q4 report and 2018 guidance as well as free cash flow rising with a reduced tax rate, to as high as $26/share in 2020, helping push the shares to new all-time highs; analysts at Baird, Citi and elsewhere also have raised price targets.
    • The stock's rise continued virtually uninterrupted today despite a report that Brazil regulators will come out against BA's potential takeover of Embraer (ERJ -0.2%).
    • ETFs: DIA, UDOW, DOG, DXD, SDOW, DDM, UDPIX
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 43 Comments
  • UNH

    UnitedHealth's Q4 beat buoys peers

    • UnitedHealth Group's (UNH +2.2%) Q4 results, reported yesterday, have stoked buying the managed care/health insurance space.
    • Selected tickers: (AET +0.3%)(ANTM +3.1%)(CNC +1.9%)(CI +2.7%)(CIVI +0.6%)(HUM +2%)(MOH +2.8%)(WCG +1.8%)(GTS +2.8%)
    • Previously: UnitedHealth Group beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Jan. 16)
    • Previously: UnitedHealth Group Q4 revenues up 10%; non-GAAP EPS up 23%; updates 2018 guidance (Jan. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom calls FTC probe 'immaterial'; shares resume gains

    • After a quick slide earlier this afternoon following the report of an FTC investigation, Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) has reclaimed positive territory, now up 1%.
    • Broadcom has confirmed the probe and says it's "immaterial" to its business and won't have an impact on the company's pending acquisition of Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM).
    • As noted, the probe has been ongoing but doesn't concern the company's wireless segment.
    • Shares are almost back to their session high of $266.53; they had dipped as low as $260.46 (down 1.1%) after the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 13 Comments
  • IDTI

    Barclays upgrades Integrated Device Technology on tailwinds

    • Barclays upgrades Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI) from Underweight to Equal Weight and raises the price target from $28 to $33, which is 4% higher than yesterday’s close.
    • Firm sees a strong year ahead for memory interface with improving unit and higher DRAM loading tailwinds. 
    • Barclays isn’t in love with wireless charging but with Apple’s support, the firm does see a tailwind in Android. 
    • Integrated Device Technology shares are up 2.9% to $32.66.         
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 3 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (1/17/18)

    • Gainers: ICHR +17%. MOMO +11%. PSTG +10%. PCOM +10%. CTRL +9%.
    • Losers: HIVE -29%. CPAH -26%. SPI -18%. ATEN -14%. SQNS -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • VIA

    WSJ: Shari Redstone looks for new CBS directors in Viacom re-merger push

    • Viacom's jumping (VIA +1.9%, VIAB +2.7%) and CBS isn't (a quick downturn to -2%) as The Wall Street Journal notes Shari Redstone is looking for new directors at CBS as she pushes to re-merge the companies.
    • She may want to make the move this quarter, sources told the WSJ, and Redstone has reached out to (previously resistant) CBS chief Les Moonves to push the idea.
    • CBS is planning to propose replacing several names on the board when it meets in May, and Shari Redstone is gathering names of possible new candidates, according to the report.
    • Previously: Viacom lower as Rosenblatt cuts to Sell amid CBS merger chatter (Jan. 16 2018)
    • Previously: Viacom, CBS jump on report of new re-merger pursuit (Jan. 12 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 19 Comments
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica started with Buy at R.F. Rafferty

    • U.S. Silica (SLCA +2%) is higher after R.F. Lafferty initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a $52 price target, saying SLCA is well positioned to benefit from higher demand for proppant from the oil and gas industry.
    • The oil and gas proppants segment accounted for 81% of SLCA's revenues during the first nine months of 2017, and the company's expected supply of up to 23.5M tons by mid-2018 would represent ~24% of the total market, the firm calculates.
    • Besides supplying frac sand to the market, SLCA also is capable of delivering product directly to the well site with its last-mile solutions through SandBox, Lafferty says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 8 Comments
  • GE

    GE continues lower as analysts see problems with potential breakup

    • General Electric (GE -4.4%) sheds another 4%-plus following yesterday's 3% slide, wiping out its heretofore strong start to the new year, as analysts say the surprise charges announced yesterday (I, II, III) further damage the company’s credibility.
    • J.P. Morgan says it is becomingly increasingly difficult to justify its $16 stock price target, as there may be "many dis-synergies not incorporated" in its previous analysis of GE whose unknown risks may justify a further degraded value of $12-$16, closer to Cowen analyst Gautam Khanna's analysis of GE's sum-of-the-parts that suggests a breakup valuation of $11-$15/share.
    • Rather than break up into pieces, Jeffrey Sprague of Vertical Research Partners believes GE is more likely to sell its 62% stake in Baker Hughes (BHGE +0.4%) and possibly spin off part of its aircraft leasing business.
    • “Investors don’t want conglomerates anymore and the other conglomerates are breaking up,” says Melius Research's Scott Davis, who also thinks a breakup process would not be overly complicated as GE's liabilities could be assigned to the spinoffs and the bloated pension would get allocated according to the percentage of employees spun off, and debt also could be put into the units.
    • Davis believes the separate businesses would perform well, since GE typically is among the top three companies in any given sector where it has a presence.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 65 Comments
  • ASML

    B. Riley raises ASML price target, recommends AMAT and Lam Research

    • B. Riley raises its ASML (ASML +7.5%) price target from $166 to $200 following the premarket earnings report.
    • Firm says ASML exited CY17 with a strong Q4 beat and that while the Q1 outlook was lower, overall performance was better than expected. 
    • Earnings tailwinds were order and backlog strengths, which hint at strong CY18 Y/Y sales growth. 
    • Firm thinks the target of CY20 EPS at €9.00 is attainable. CY18 and CY19 EPS estimates increased to €6.01 (was: €5.22) and €7.78 (was: €7.04).
    • B. Riley does see better value in Buy-rated Applied Materials (AMAT +4.7%) with a $71 price target and Lam Research (LRCX +6.5%) with a $250 price target.   
    • Previously: ASML Holding higher 5.7% after Q4 profit and sales beat (Jan. 17)
    • Previously: Semiconductor stocks moving after ASML, Ichor news (Jan. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 11 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (1/17/2018)

    • Gainers: USAU +12%. DNR +7%. SGY +7%. CLMT +7%. CRR +6%.
    • Losers: RCON -20%. ASIX -7%. ADNT -6%. ENSV -6%. WLB -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • T

    Sprint presses free-year promotion in new shot at Verizon

    • With a couple of its best-known promotions wrapping up, Sprint (S -1%) is calling attention to a big one wrapping up this month: a free year of unlimited service for switchers who bring their device.
    • As FierceWireless' Mike Dano points out, while the promotion covers about three dozen phones, it targets one rival in particular: "Stop feeling ripped off by Verizon." (VZ -0.2%)
    • Verizon was also in Sprint's sights when it launched this promotion before, what Craig Moffett called the "most aggressive" in U.S. wireless history, and it juiced Sprint's quarter then.
    • The deal runs through the end of the month. Sprint is expected to report quarterly results before the open on Tuesday, Jan. 30.
    • In other trading action among the Big Four: T +0.3%, TMUS +2.1%.
    • Updated: Sprint says that it's allowed switchers to take advantage of the promotion beyond last summer's expiration; it will end the offer Jan. 31.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 50 Comments
  • PRTO

    Proteon Therapeutics follows through on recent breakout, up 19%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Proteon Therapeutics (PRTO +19.1%) is up on a 4x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 205K shares, following through on last Thursday's breakout. Shares have rallied almost 50% since then.
    • No particular news accounts for the action. On the data front, preliminary results from a second Phase 3 study, PATENCY-2, assessing lead candidate vonapanitase's ability to extend the patency of radiocephalic fistulas (vascular access point for hemodialysis) in chronic kidney disease patients should be available later this year. The first Phase 3, PATENCY-1, failed to demonstrate a treatment effect over placebo.
    • On the financing front, the company raised $22M last June via the sale of convertible preferred stock which it says will be sufficient to fund operations into Q4 2019, more than enough time to report results from PATENCY-2. At the end of September 2017, its quick asset balance was $47.4M.
    • Previously: Proteon's lead product candidate flunks late-stage study in chronic kidney disease; shares plummet 73% premarket (Dec. 13, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom goes red on word of FTC competition investigation

    • Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) has tumbled into negative ground on the day, quickly down 1%, on word from The Wall Street Journal that the Federal Trade Commission is investigating whether it engaged in anticompetitive tactics in customer negotiations.
    • The company has changed some contracts so they call for customers to buy a percentage of output of a certain item, rather than an absolute number, sources told WSJ.
    • The probe has been ongoing for months, according to the report.
    • The limited scope of the probe reportedly does not cover Broadcom's wireless segment.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 4 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: WHLR +12%. SIEB +9%.YRD +7%. EHTH +5%.
    • Losers: GROW -8%. IIPR -7%. QTS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers (1/17/2018)

    • Gainers: JUNO +49%. ORPN +24%. NURO +24%. AEZS +23%. XBIO +23%. PRTO +19%. ICHR +17%. FFHL +17%. MTSL +16%. ZAGG +14%.
    • Losers: HIVE -28%. CPAH -28%. GNCA -26%. RCON -20%. NEWA -19%. SPI -16%. ATEN -16%. HTGM -14%. FTD -14%. MYSZ -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • DLR

    Digital Realty dips as Credit Suisse starts at Neutral

    • Digital Realty (NYSE:DLR) is 2.1% lower today after an initiation at Neutral by Credit Suisse, which sees a company still in progress on a pivot away from its pure-play roots in wholesale data centers.
    • The company is making headway on keeping up with peers by offering various lease sizes and deployment types, the firm says.
    • It's lagging peers on capital deployment intensity relative to revenue growth, though. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Analyst Sami Badri has a $95 price target, a street low, implying 10% downside from current pricing.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 7 Comments
  • EXEL

    Investors unmoved by Exelixis' late-stage liver cancer data on cabozantinib; shares down 9%

    • Exelixis (EXEL -9%) is down on a 67% spike in volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 3 clinical trial assessing lead drug cabozantinib in previously treated hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
    • The study, CELESTIAL, demonstrated the superiority of cabozantinib over placebo in median overall survival (OS) (10.2 months vs. 8.0 months; p=0.0049), median progression-free survival (PFS) (5.2 months vs. 1.9 months; p<0.0001) and objective response rate (ORR) (4% vs. 0.4%; p=0.0086). The disease control rate (responders + those with stable disease) was 64% in the treatment group compared to 33% for placebo.
    • In a subgroup of HCC patients previously with Bayer's NEXAVAR (sorafenib) only, median OS was 11.3 months (7.2 months for placebo) and median PFS was 5.5 months (placebo: 1.9 months).
    • Investors appear disappointed that there was not more separation from Bayer's (OTCPK:BAYRY) STIVARGA (regorafenib), approved in the U.S. for second-line HCC last April. Data from the Phase 3 RESORCE study showed median OS of 10.6 months, median PFS of 3.4 months and an ORR of 7%.
    • Late-stage data for NEXAVAR in a first-line setting in HCC showed median OS of 10.7 months and median PFS of 5.5 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 10 Comments
  • ADNT

    Adient -7% as Q1 results expected to be hurt by SS&M headwinds

    • Adient (ADNT -7.3%) is sharply lower after a slide presentation says Q1 results will be "significantly" impacted by headwinds affecting its Seat Structures & Mechanisms business including commodity prices and availability as well as launch inefficiencies, which have intensified since the company's Q4 earnings call.
    • Despite growth from China operations and management's efforts to mitigate the near-term challenges, ADNT says overall margins likely will take a "modest step backwards" in 2018.
    • Shares are lower despite yesterday's news that ADNT entered a joint venture with Boeing to develop, manufacture and sell airplane seats to airlines and aircraft leasing companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 6 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: FFHL +12%. SGOC +5%.
    • Losers: DFBG-OLD -13%. XELB -8%. NVFY -8%. ETH -7%. F -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 11 Comments
  • MOS

    Mosaic, CF Industries continue to slide on fertilizer market concerns

    • Mosaic (MOS -1.4%) and CF Industries (CF -2%) extend yesterday's sharp losses for combined two-day declines of 7% and 8%, respectively, a day after Credit Suisse analyst reiterated a cautious view of the fertilizer sector, seeing little to no evidence of improvement in key global demand drivers.
    • Credit Suisse sees a significant degree of new supply previously planned to hit in 2017 which will now arrive this year, and that fertilizer markets will remain supply driven in 2018, driving volatile pricing and keeping profitability "lower for longer."
    • The firm thinks MOS will face a challenging 2018, reiterating an Underperform rating as phosphate prices and margins likely will disappoint, while its top pick in the sector is FMC Corp. (FMC -0.7%), citing greater opportunity for revenue synergies in the ag business, especially in India, as well as recent strength in lithium pricing.
    • Credit Suisse believes CF's cost-advantaged position should see the fertilizer business generate solid cash margins despite pricing volatility, but Hedgeye reportedly says it sees 50%-plus downside risk in CF shares, as lower nitrogen imports are not a sign of an improving market.
    • The firm rates Nutrien <NTR> as Neutral, seeing potash headwinds mounting in H2 2018.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 13 Comments
  • QCOM

    Canaccord raises Qualcomm price target to 26% upside

    • Canaccord Genuity raises its Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) price target by $3 to $86 after the company’s shareholder letter. The price target is 26% higher than yesterday’s closing price.
    • ”Qualcomm’s acquisition of NXP remains on track and will create a company with significant earnings power and cash flow, developing into a clear industry leader in the mobile, IoT, and automotive semiconductor markets backed by the extremely strong combined IP portfolio of Qualcomm, NXP, and Freescale,” writes analyst T. Michael Walkley.
    • The firm also believes Apple and Qualcomm will ultimately settle their legal battles.  
    • Qualcomm shares are up 0.4% to $68.53. 
    • Previously: Macquarie raises Qualcomm price target on Broadcom, price cuts (Jan. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 22 Comments
  • RLMD

    Relmada nabs expanded rights to CNS candidate dextromethadone; shares ahead 8%

    • Relmada Therapeutics (OTCQB:RLMD +8.3%) has acquired global rights to develop and commercialize lead candidate dextromethadone (REL-1017) for the treatment of neurological conditions, including certain rare diseases, that affect the central nervous system (CNS). It previously owned the rights to the drug for psychological and psychiatric disorders, including depression, anxiety, fatigue and mood instability. Financial terms are not disclosed.
    • A Phase 2a study assessing dextromethadone for the adjunctive treatment of major depressive disorder, a Fast Track designation in the U.S., should launch no later than Q2.
    • Dextromethadone, an N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor antagonist, is a single isomer of methadone but has no opioid- or ketamine-like toxicities. It is being developed to treat neuropathic pain in addition to depression.
    • Previously: Relmada's lead product candidate REL-1017 Fast Track'd for MDD; shares ahead 20% premarket (April 13, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • WDAY

    Workday +1.3% on Duo Security partnership

    • Workday (NYSE:WDAY) announces a partnership with Duo Security, which specializes in trusted access and multi-factor authentication technologies.
    • Workday will integrate Duo’s MFA functionality within the Workday user interface to offer customers further safeguards to mitigate phishing incidents. 
    • Workday plans to make the Duo solutions available in 1H18.  
    • Workday shares are up 1.3%.  
    • Previously: Workday acquires enterprise AI company (Jan. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • PSO

    Pearson -3.9% after warning of drag in North American sales

    • Pearson (NYSE:PSO) is down 3.9% in NYSE trading after warning that 2018 earnings will be pressured by North American results.
    • Sales of U.S. higher education course materials are expected to fall 3% on an underlying basis, it said, at the low end of its guidance.
    • Higher ed courseware is about a quarter of Pearson and the rest is doing well, says CEO John Fallon: "We have said we are running Pearson on the basis that higher ed courseware is going to decline in underlying terms by about 5 or 6 percent per year through to the end of 2019 at which point we expect it to stabilize and start to grow again."
    • It forecast 2018 operating profit of £520M-£560M, which would represent underlying growth after accounting for asset sales and forex.

    Onconova stays the course with late-stage study of rigosertib in MDS; shares up 13%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Onconova Therapeutics (ONTX +12.6%) is up on a healthy 36x surge in volume (although down almost 30% from the intraday high of $2.66) on the heels of its announcement that it will advance the Phase 3 INSPIRE study assessing lead candidate rigosertib in patients with treatment-resistant myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) and will expand enrollment.
    • The company made its decision following an interim analysis by the independent Data Monitoring Committee. It remains blinded to the preliminary data.
    • Rigosertib is a small molecule that inhibits cellular signaling by acting as a Ras protein mimetic. Ras is a family of proteins that are involved in transmitting signals within cells. When switched "on", it activates other proteins that ultimately turn on genes involved in cell growth, differentiation and survival.
    • Previously: Onconova up 18% on positive Phase 3 outlook on lead candidate rigosertib (Oct. 9, 2017)

  • EXAS

    Exact Sciences under pressure on potential CRC blood screening test; shares down 9%

    • Exact Sciences (EXAS -8.6%) is down in early trading on light volume on the heels of an ASCO announcement of a new study assessing a liquid biopsy test for colorectal cancer (CRC) that showed up to 88% accuracy. The results of the Taiwan-based study will be presented at the ASCO-GI Symposium in San Francisco later this week.
    • Researchers collected blood samples from 620 adult patients who underwent routine colonoscopies or had confirmed CRC. Based on the results from colonoscopy and biopsy, 438 (70.6%) had either pre-cancerous growths or early-to-late-stage CRC.
    • The sensitivity (correctly identifying true positives) of the blood test, an assay that captures rare circulating tumor cells, was 77% in the pre-cancerous lesion group and 87% in the confirmed CRC group.
    • The specificity (correctly identifying true negatives) was 97%.
    • The overall accuracy (sensitivity and specificity) was 84 - 88% between pre-cancerous and cancerous samples.
    • Co-author Ashish Nimgaonkar, M.D., says over 80% of patients reluctant to undergo a colonoscopy would be prefer a blood test over a stool-based test. He adds that the blood test can potentially be offered for less than $100.
    • Exact Sciences' Cologuard is 92% sensitive and 87% specific in confirmed CRC, but its performance goes down significantly in pre-cancerous lesions with a sensitivity of only 42% (Cologuard Physician Brochure, page 8).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 182 Comments

  • BLRX

    BioLineRx announces partial monotherapy results from Phase 2a COMBAT study in pancreatic cancer

    • BioLineRx (NASDAQ:BLRX) announces partial results from the monotherapy portion of BL-8040's Phase 2a COMBAT study showing that BL-8040 increases infiltration of T cells into the tumor in patients with metastatic pancreatic cancer.
    • The data will be presented at the ASCO 2018 Gastrointestinal Cancers Symposium, on January 19 in San Francisco, CA.
    • The partial results shows that BL-8040 was safe and well-tolerated. The results showed up to a 15-fold increase in CD3+ T cells, and up to a 2-fold increase in CD8+ T cells, in the TME of 43% (3/7) of the patients, after five days of BL-8040 monotherapy.
    • Topline results of the study are expected by H2 2018.
    • BL-8040 is a short peptide for the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia, solid tumors, and stem cell mobilization.
    • Shares are up 1% premarket on light volume.
